channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: These 6 Android Settings Could Be Putting Your Privacy in Danger
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Keep your privacy secure by turning off these Android settings.
item.content:encoded: Your smartphone knows more about you than you know about yourself. Okay, that might be hyperbole, but it's still so important to manage the settings that track both your online and offline activity. Here are six Android settings that could put your privacy at risk and what you can do to keep your personal data safe.

item.title: This Turbocharged Crossover Delivers Affordable Thrills
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: This turbocharged crossover blends lively performance, sharp handling, and everyday practicality without breaking the bank.
item.content:encoded: Performance and practicality rarely go hand in hand, especially in the compact crossover world. Yet one model manages to break that rule, offering genuine excitement without sacrificing everyday usability or value. With its turbocharged powertrain, sleek design, and premium interior, this crossover proves you don’t need a sports car to enjoy a thrilling drive.

item.title: 4 Big iPhone Features That Aren't Available in the United States
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Think your iPhone has every feature? Think again.
item.content:encoded: “Designed by Apple in California” is a phrase that many have come to associate with the iPhone, but not all iPhones are built equally. Depending on where in the world you purchase and use your iPhone, you may have access to more features or other small differences in your device.

item.title: Microsoft Is Cracking Down on Local Accounts, Here's What They're Likely to Go After Next
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: Microsoft is shutting down Windows 11 setup bypass tricks, and more loopholes could be next, leaving Home and Pro users with fewer options.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft is about to roll out patches to prevent the easiest way you had to skip signing into a Microsoft account during Windows 11’s setup, and if that seemed like a gentle nudge, it’s likely just the beginning. You’ve probably used these tricks before, or at least read about them: disconnect the network, run a command, or drop a patched ISO on a USB and roll right past the Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE) screens. Microsoft calling this out as “skipping critical setup screens” is partly true, but it seems like a convenient way to keep you locked into OneDrive, Office 365 trials, and a steady stream of telemetry that the company can use.

item.title: Why Are CRT TV Screens So Hard to Photograph?
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Discover the surprising reason behind CRT screens' elusive nature in photos and videos.
item.content:encoded: If you're deep in the CRT hobby like I am now, you've probably realized that when you try to share your hobby online, your screens don't quite look right on camera. This is nothing new, and happens because of the fundamental way CRTs work.

item.title: How to Turn Off Annoying AI Features on Your Google Pixel Phone
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Get rid of unwanted AI features from your Pixel.
item.content:encoded: One of the major selling points of the Pixel phones is their AI features. However, I'm not a big fan of AI features on a smartphone. If you're like me, then keep reading to find out how to turn off all the annoying AI features on your Google Pixel phone.

item.title: Can You Really Hear the Difference Between Lossless and Lossy Compressed Audio?
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Ditching lossless audio might be no loss at all.
item.content:encoded: With lossless audio coming to Spotify Premium, this high-fidelity audio option is now available to most music streaming subscribers on big services. That's great in principle, but is it worth sacrificing your bandwidth, storage space, and paying a premium to have access to lossless media?

item.title: Keycap Shape Matters More To Your Keyboard Than You Think
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: A good keyboard starts with the shape of your keycaps.
item.content:encoded: If you're customizing your mechanical keyboard with aftermarket keycaps, it helps to understand their shapes (aka keycap profiles) so that you can pick the right ones. Here’s a quick crash course on everything you need to know about keycap profiles.

item.title: You're Using This Powerful Tech Constantly and Didn't Know It
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Extracting text from pictures has never been easier.
item.content:encoded: Have you ever seen the term “optical character recognition” or OCR and wondered what it meant? Well, I’m here to help you understand what OCR is. It’s very possible that you’ve used OCR and didn’t know it. You might have even used it today. Here’s everything you need to know about optical character recognition.

item.title: 8 Smartphone Habits You Should Probably Stop Doing
item.dc:creator: Kabir Jain
item.description: Some of these "pro tips" belong in a museum.
item.content:encoded: We’ve all picked up weird habits with our phones over the years. Little routines that made sense at the time, passed down like tech folklore. “Close your apps to save battery.” “Never charge overnight.” “Let your battery hit zero before plugging it in.”
